name: Space-Walnut
description:
Its a cool game done with networking.

Description:

You play as 4 players with each player controlling their own leak on each of the spaceship's four sides. Each player only has one button to press and pressing that button is the equivalent as covering the leak on the spaceship. When they press the button their assigned leak will be covered and no oxygen will leak out. When not pressing the button, the oxygen of the spaceship will leak out of that particular hole, and the spaceship will gain momentum in the opposite direction.

You guys have to work together, communicate and be thrifty about your oxygen because when you run out its game over and the level restarts!

Controls:

Computer:
Press the buttons 5,6,7,8 to connect players and then hold the buttons 1,2,3,4 to begin the game.

Phone:
Use your phone and press the screen to cover the leaking oxygen.

The team:

  • Henning Steinbock (network programming)
  • Jarl Falke (game programming)
  • Ruud (interface programming)
  • Mads Fog Nielsen (technical artist, producing)
  • Tobias E. Stenderup (level design, finding sounds)
